Dialogue.NPCText:
A veiled woman stands in the shadows of the Sunreach bazaar. Her voice is a whisper that cuts through the bustle.

"Tread carefully, friend. Words have weight here, and I trade in nothing but the heaviest secrets.
I am Zaida, Mistress of Whispers. You have business, or merely curiosity?"

Option.text: I hear you can provide information—for a price.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She smiles, though her eyes remain hidden.

"What am I? A shadow that whispers to the powerful, a rumor that topples kings. My allegiances shift with the winds—today, I am for myself. Tomorrow? Perhaps for you… if you prove useful."

Option.text: What do you want from me?
How do you know so much about Sunreach?
Never mind, I have no business here.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Sunreach is a city built on secrets and sand. Every merchant, every pirate, every councilor owes me a debt—though few realize it until it's far too late.
If you wish to survive here, you must learn the art of discretion. Or else, hire one who has mastered it."

Option.text: Do you have any tasks for me?

Dialogue.NPCText: "My knowledge is not free. Some pay in coin, others in loyalty—or blood. But today, I seek something rare: the truth of an artifact lost beneath Sunreach, a relic that can sway the Council's votes. Find it for me, and I will owe you a debt greater than gold."

Option.text: That sounds dangerous. Who else seeks it?
I have no interest in council politics.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Her voice lowers.

"Everyone seeks it—Darius, Seraphine, even Thornwall, though he’s too cowardly to admit it. The Minax cultists want it to puppet the council. I want it for leverage, nothing more. Help me, and I’ll make sure you leave Sunreach richer… and alive."

Option.text: Very well. Tell me what I must do.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Beneath Sunreach’s oldest cistern lies the *Signet of Silent Dominion*—an ancient ring that, when worn, compels a single council vote in your favor. It vanished decades ago. I believe Minax cultists now guard it in the undercity.

Bring me the Signet, and I will reward you with secrets the council would kill for. Fail… and perhaps you’ll become just another rumor."

Option.text: How do I find the cistern?

Dialogue.NPCText: "Seek the oldest well in the Silk Quarter. A word to the right beggar—'Silver flows downward'—and you will be shown the way below. But beware: not all beggars serve honest coin."

Option.text: Thank you. I’ll seek the well.
Is there anything else I should know?

Dialogue.NPCText: "Minax’s cultists—masked, branded, half-mad. They trust no outsider. There is a password: 'Obedience is silence.' Speak it at their gate or you’ll never leave alive. But remember—betray me, and I will know."

Zaida’s veil twitches—a hint of amusement.

"Return with the Signet, and I will reveal to you:
- Darius Veynar’s greatest blackmail,
- The true allegiance of Lady Seraphine,
- Or the names of Minax’s hidden cultists in Sunreach.
Choose one, and the other secrets may yet be for sale…"

Option.text: Knowledge is more precious than gold. I accept.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She leans in, voice barely audible.

"Trust nothing in the undercity—least of all the ones who seem helpful. If you are caught, speak my name only as a last resort. Even I have enemies in the dark."

Option.text: Understood. I’ll return with the Signet.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Zaida produces a thin scroll sealed in black wax.

"Take this. The scroll marks your claim to the Signet—and to my favor, should you return. Do not lose it. Do not trust anyone who offers to 'help.'"

Option.text: I won’t fail you, Mistress of Whispers.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Zaida tilts her head, unreadable.

"Very well. In Sunreach, even silence is an answer. If you need what I offer, the shadows will find you."

Her laughter is a whisper, laced with venom and velvet.

"A bold request. Most who seek my story never live to tell it.
Still… the stars are restless tonight. Why not indulge a little mythology?"

Option.text: What drives you to gather secrets?
Have you crossed paths with Minax?

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Sunreach? No, child.
I was born in the shadow of Wind, among scholars too arrogant to imagine betrayal.
I was once one of them… until I whispered the truth too loudly and paid for it in blood and exile."

Option.text: That explains your disdain for mages.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Betrayed, flayed, and banished—yes.
They feared I knew too much… because I did.
The archives beneath Wind spoke of more than spells. They spoke of the Shards... and the Mistress who would reunite them."

"Secrets are leverage. They are currency that never devalues.
Every smile in Sunreach hides a dagger. I simply make sure mine is sharper.

Now tell me, mortal... do you collect secrets as I do?"

Option.text: I’m just a curious fool, perhaps.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Then we are kindred, you and I. Here, take this boon. Use it wisely, and perhaps next time, I'll whisper something truly dangerous."

Option.text: Thank you. We will speak again.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Blades break. Secrets endure. But I do not fault you—sometimes, a sword is the truest lie-detector of all."

"Minax? She is the echo behind the silence, the fracture in the mirror.
I have not served her... but I have *listened* when she speaks through others."

"I fear *nothing*—but I *respect* chaos when it wears a woman’s face.
You’d do well to do the same. Even now, her agents shift beneath your feet."

Option.text: Then perhaps I should shift too.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Admire? No. But I understand her. Power corrupts; Minax merely removed the mask.
We are all monsters given the right motive. She simply stopped pretending otherwise."

Option.text: Perhaps you're more alike than you admit.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Her voice tightens.

"Careful, friend. Some mirrors crack when stared into too long."

(Her veil stiffens. The air goes still.)

"That… is a very dangerous question.
Come back when you’ve walked the bloodpaths beneath Qasaria. Perhaps then, we will speak plainly."

"Prophecy is just memory, poorly timed.
The Gem was never whole. Neither was Britannia. Perhaps Minax is not the villain—we are simply the wrong audience."

Option.text: You speak like someone who’s still deciding.
